definition: a light touch or stroke, make a solicitation or entreaty for something
details:
noun
- a light touch or stroke
= synonyms: dab, pat
- the act of tapping a telephone or telegraph line to get information
= synonyms: wiretap
- a plug for a bunghole in a cask
= synonyms: spigot
- a tool for cutting female (internal) screw threads
- a small metal plate that attaches to the toe or heel of a shoe (as in tap dancing)
- a faucet for drawing water from a pipe or cask
= synonyms: hydrant, water faucet, water tap
- the sound made by a gentle blow
= synonyms: pat, rap
- a gentle blow
= synonyms: strike
verb
- make a solicitation or entreaty for something
= synonyms: solicit
- draw from
= synonyms: exploit
- strike lightly
= example: strike lightly
= synonyms: tip
- cut a female screw thread with a tap
- pierce in order to draw a liquid from
= example: pierce in order to draw a liquid from
- draw (liquor) from a tap
= example: draw (liquor) from a tap
- dance and make rhythmic clicking sounds by means of metal plates nailed to the sole of the dance shoes
= example: dance and make rhythmic clicking sounds by means of metal plates nailed to the sole of the dance shoes
= synonyms: tapdance
- walk with a tapping sound
- make light, repeated strikes on a surface
= example: make light, repeated strikes on a surface
= synonyms: pink, knock, rap
- tap a telephone or telegraph wire to get information
= example: tap a telephone or telegraph wire to get information
= synonyms: wiretap, bug, intercept
- draw from or dip into to get something
= example: draw from or dip into to get something
- furnish with a tap or spout, so as to be able to draw liquid from it
= example: furnish with a tap or spout, so as to be able to draw liquid from it
